beats.label: HOOK
beats.narration: We gave Iowa Wind and Rock the verdict: Wind-Blasted Odyssey. Elite tier. 63 out of 100. Let me tell you what that really means.
beats.text_on_screen: Iowa Wind and Rock: Wind-Blasted Odyssey
beats.visual: Verdict badge slam + tier badge + avatar
beats.editing_note: Open with verdict like a boxing title card. Avatar with villain energy. Music: ominous build. PROMISE the viewer they'll learn the real story.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap + cognitive dissonance (verdict vs expectation).

beats.label: WHAT THEY TELL YOU
beats.narration: Every race has a highlight reel. Here's theirs.
beats.visual: Marketing highlights overlay — strengths as bullet points

broll_sources.query: Iowa Wind and Rock official trailer
Iowa Wind and Rock promo video

beats.editing_note: Read strengths in an exaggerated 'promotional voice.' Avatar side-eyes camera. Bright, clean visuals — this is the 'too good to be true' section. CONTRAST PATTERN: this calm section sets up the burst at 0:50.

strengths: 340 miles is genuine ultra-endurance challenge—tests limits beyond typical racing
Self-supported format teaches true independence and problem-solving under fatigue
Iowa Gravel Series organization provides solid GPS track and safety support
Resupply at Iowa small towns adds human connection and real-world adventure feel
Reasonable value ($150-200) for ultra-endurance format with tracking and finisher awards

beats.label: WHAT THEY DON'T TELL YOU
beats.visual: Red flag overlay — weaknesses with warning icons

broll_sources.query: Iowa Wind and Rock course preview
gravel cycling Fast Iowa gravel with constant rolling undulation

beats.editing_note: BURST SEQUENCE at 0:50 transition (pattern interrupt). 5-10 quick cuts: meme reaction, avatar facepalm, red overlay flash, warning sound. Then settle into analysis. Each weakness gets its own visual card + avatar reaction.

weaknesses: Wind exposure for 30-50 hours is psychologically crushing—constant headwinds break morale
April weather unpredictability: rain/mud can make course unrideable, cold tests gear
340 miles is significantly longer than most ultras—bonking at Mile 200 leaves 140 miles remaining
Self-supported format means no external motivation, aid stations, or crowds—purely internal battle
Limited national prestige and small field depth—not attracting competitive racing atmosphere

beats.label: THE NUMBERS DON'T LIE
beats.narration: Fourteen dimensions. No opinions. Just scores. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Low altitude. Breathe easy. Iowa farmland around 1,000 feet poses zero physiological challenge from altitude. Technicality. 2 out of 5. Your road bike might survive. Might. Iowa gravel stays non-technical but fresh rock creates challenges. Elevation. 2 out of 5. Rolling terrain. Nothing that'll break you. Rolling farmland delivers 25,000-29,000 feet over 340+ miles through constant undulation rather than big climbs.
beats.visual: Score cards — lowest 3 dimensions with explanations
beats.editing_note: RE-ENGAGEMENT BEAT — this is the ~2 min mark. Start with the least bad score, escalate to worst. Each score reveal: brief silence (0.5s), then number slams in. Avatar reaction scales with how bad the score is. Von Restorff: visually isolate the worst score (different color, bigger text, longer hold). [RIFF HERE] after the worst score reveal.

beats.label: THE BOTTOM LINE
beats.narration: Iowa Wind and Rock rewards riders who value internal challenge and self-discovery over external validation. If you need crowds, frequent aid, or competitive atmosphere, skip it. If you want to discover what you're capable of when forced to grind through 340 miles of wind, darkness. And fatigue alone, this is your test. Budget 30-50 hours. Bring redundant everything. Accept that the finish line is about not quitting, not about speed.
beats.editing_note: PAYOFF. Close the open loop from the hook. Avatar delivers final take directly to camera. End ABRUPTLY — never signal 'we're wrapping up.' MrBeast rule: cut to CTA mid-energy.
